SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

net.rcode.nanomaps
Class MapSurface

java.lang.Object
  RelativeLayout
      net.rcode.nanomaps.MapSurface
All Implemented Interfaces:
MapConstants, MapStateAware
public class MapSurface
extends RelativeLayout
implements MapStateAware, MapConstants

Manages a map surface. The MapSurface is a RelativeLayout that can be used to position controls, etc. It contains MapContentView children corresponding to discrete display layers.

Author:
stella

Field Summary
static int LAYER_BACKGROUND
          The background layer will contain background drawables, generally the thatch pattern that is below the map

          The map layer should contain views for drawing the map (ie MapTileView) stacked in order of display.

Field Detail

LAYER_BACKGROUND

public static final int LAYER_BACKGROUND
The background layer will contain background drawables, generally the thatch pattern that is below the map

See Also:
Constant Field Values

LAYER_MAP

public static final int LAYER_MAP
The map layer should contain views for drawing the map (ie MapTileView) stacked in order of display. Touch events are handled from this layer.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

LAYER_SHADOW

public static final int LAYER_SHADOW
By convention, the SHADOW layer is where you will want to put overlay shadows

See Also:
Constant Field Values

addOverlay

public void addOverlay(View child,
                       int layer)
Add an unmanaged overlay to the given map layer. This is a shortcut for getLayer(order).addView(child). This method should only be used for global overlays such as MapTileView or other views that internally manage their own location.

Parameters:
order -
child -

addOverlay

public void addOverlay(View child,
                       int layer,
                       Coordinate location)
Adds a managed View to the given layer at the given global position. Shortcut for getLayer(layer).addView(child, new MapLayer.LayoutParams(location));

Parameters:
order -
location -

refreshOverlayLayout

public void refreshOverlayLayout(View child)
If the child is attached to a MapLayer call the refreshChildLayout() method on it. Call this method after changing any fields in the overlay's LayoutParams

Parameters:
child -

setOverlayPosition

public void setOverlayPosition(View child,
                               Coordinate location)
Shortcut to update the Location in a child's LayoutParams and refresh it in its parent. The child must have been added to the map already.

Parameters:
child -
location -

translateChildToMap

public boolean translateChildToMap(View child,
                                   Point point)
Translates a child's coordinates (as most often found in a MotionEvent) to global viewport coordinates on this map.

Parameters:
point -
Returns:
true if successful, false if the view is not on this map
